intro: Gyaladenia conica subsp. transvaalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features slender, erect stems that bear whorled clusters of bell-shaped flowers, typically in shades of blue or purple. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
